Model Module¶

Model Module¶

class Model.Model[source]¶

Bases: object

The model holds all the relevant data. Since there are no static classes in python, the methods have to annotated with the @staticmethod annotation in order to access the functions without an instance.

static add_worker(w)[source]¶
Parameters:w – the worker to be added to the worker list
Returns:None
static delete_worker(w)[source]¶
Parameters:w – the worker to be deleted from the worker list
Returns:None
static disable_logging()[source]¶

sets the logging member to False :return: None

static enable_logging()[source]¶

sets the logging member to True :return: None

static get_last_id()[source]¶
Returns:the id of the last worker added to the list as an int
static get_worker()[source]¶
Returns:the list of Worker threads
static is_logging()[source]¶
Returns:the logging member whether it’s True or False
logging = False¶
worker_list = []¶
